pr_title: [core] Revamp the language version alias APIs

timeline.message:
[core] Revamp the language version alias APIs

 - The old experimental API allowed calls such as
`addVersions(langHandler, false)` which were not only invalid, but would
throw an `ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException`, so we split the name
(required) and the aliases (varargs, and therefore optional)
 - In doing so, I was bothered by parameter order. The version name is
the most significant change when setting 2 versions for a language, so I
liked it being first as the old `addVersion` method did, so I moved
that ahead.
 - With that, I now had 2 methods that where equivalent, except one
allowed for varargs and the other didn't… so I merged them. This is not
100% binary compatible, but it is source compatible (that is, unless you
used reflection, all valid calls to the old non-experimental method
still work).

timeline.bodyText:
this change is unrelated, but the language attribute is not required in rule definition (may be provided by the rule implementation directly), so this may produce NPEs for definitions such as:
<!-- AccessorClassGenerationRule is an AbstractJavaRule, which sets language to Java, 
maximumLanguageVersion is invalid, but the builder is never explicitly told the language -->
<rule name="AccessorClassGeneration"
          since="1.04"
          maximumLanguageVersion="16"
          message="Avoid instantiation through private constructors from outside of the constructor's class."
          class="net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.java.rule.bestpractices.AccessorClassGenerationRule"
          externalInfoUrl="${pmd.website.baseurl}/pmd_rules_java_bestpractices.html#accessorclassgeneration">
this bug just happened to bit me during my refactors :D
timeline.author: jsotuyod

replies.bodyText: I think, we shouldn't remove the redundant overload on master, but deprecating it and removing it later is appropriate. Removing it abruptly would at least break the designer, though I don't know about other dependent projects
replies.author: oowekyala

replies.bodyText: true, we are compiling the designer against older pmd-core for release, and get a bumped pmd-core in runtime. I completely forgot about that one.
replies.author: jsotuyod

timeline.bodyText: I think we could improve further by hiding the isDefault parameter. There's only one default version, but all those calls have to mention this false argument, which is obscure unless you know what it is, or are in an IDE. We could just have addVersion for non-default versions, and a separate addDefaultVersion method
